properties.areaDesc: Outer waters from Santa Cruz Island to San Clemente Island to 60 NM offshore including San Nicolas and Santa Barbara Islands; Inner waters from Point Mugu to San Mateo Pt. CA including Santa Catalina and Anacapa Islands
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 25 at 2:18PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
Dense fog with visibility well under one mile will continue to
affect the coastal waters of southwest California through at
least tonight, and possibly well into Sunday morning. This fog is
most widespread off Los Angeles and Orange Counties, including
Catalina Island, but should soon develop over the rest of the
coastal waters including the Central Coast.

Mariners should be prepared for abrupt visibility changes down to
one nautical mile or less. Reduce speeds and be on the lookout
for exposed rocks and other vessels, including large ships in the
shipping lanes. Use radar or GPS navigation if available, and
consider remaining in harbor if such equipment is unavailable.

NWSheadline: WIDESPREAD DENSE FOG TO AFFECT COASTAL WATERS OF SOUTHWEST CALIFORNIA THROUGH AT LEAST TONIGHT
